html:
Pronunciation[edit]

  • (Classical) IPA(key): /eːˈruː.ɡoː/, [eːˈɾuː.ɡoː]
  • (Ecclesiastical) IPA(key): /eˈru.ɡo/, [ɛˈruː.ɡɔ]

Etymology 1[edit]

ex- (“out”) +‎ rūgō (“to wrinkle, to crease”).

Verb[edit]

ērūgō (present infinitive ērūgāre, perfect active ērūgāvī, supine ērūgātum); first conjugation

  1. to clear of wrinkles, to smooth

Derived terms[edit]
  • ērūgātiō

Etymology 2[edit]

ex- (“out”) +‎ *rūgō (“to belch”), from Proto-Indo-European *h₁rewg-.

Verb[edit]

ērūgō (present infinitive ērūgere, perfect active *ērūxī, supine ēructum); third conjugation

  1. to belch out
Usage notes[edit]

The prefect stem, *ērūxī, is unattested.
